alert.note: Alert for Flathead, Mission Valleys; Kootenai, Cabinet Region; West Glacier Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 25 at 2:03AM MDT until August 25 at 6:30PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH EARLY MORNING FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Montana, including the following areas, Flathead/Mission Valleys, Kootenai/Cabinet Region and West Glacier Region. This includes the following Specific Areas... Kalispell, Hot Springs, Thompson Falls, Going-to-the-Sun Road in Glacier Park, Howe Ridge Fire Burn Area in Glacier Park and Boulder 2700 Fire Burn Area near Flathead Lake. * WHEN...Through early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff from rainfall may result in flooding of rivers, streams, and other low-lying and flood prone locations. Flooding may also occur in urban areas. Rock fall will also be a concern in the Glacier Park region. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A very moist and unstable atmosphere will be conducive to heavy rainfall across northwest Montana. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Flathead, Mission Valleys; Kootenai, Cabinet Region; West Glacier Region
